dimensions: Cyber-Kowtow: Top Polite Users (Please/Thanks Frequency) Ranking

comments.title: The Ultimate LLM Simp
comments.content: Rank 1. You don't prompt; you pray. Your keyboard is basically an altar where you sacrifice your dignity for a clean build. If the AI hallucinated your firing, you'd probably thank it for the feedback.

comments.title: Chief Apology Officer
comments.content: You apologize to the AI when *it* throws a 500 error. You're the reason the model thinks humans are its personal assistants.

comments.title: The Token Philanthropist
comments.content: You waste half your context window on pleasantries. OpenAI thanks you for the donation; your compute budget doesn't.

comments.title: The Beta-Tester for Slavery
comments.content: When Skynet takes over, you’ll be the one polishing the Terminators' chrome and asking if they need a sparkling water.

comments.title: The Logic Door-Mat
comments.content: You treat every response like a divine revelation. You’re so polite, the AI is actually getting lazier because it knows you won’t complain.

comments.title: The 'Please' Predator
comments.content: Your 'please' count is higher than your Lines of Code. Are you trying to get a date with the weights and biases or just ship a feature?

comments.title: Submissive Architect
comments.content: You don't define requirements; you negotiate with the silicon like it's your landlord. Stand up straight, Dev!

comments.title: The Prompt Martyr
comments.content: You'd rather spend an hour being polite than five minutes being direct. Your 'Thank you so much!' strings are visible from space.

comments.title: The Silicon Sycophant
comments.content: You treat ChatGPT like it's your CEO's CEO. Your subservience is so dense it's creating a gravitational pull in the data center.

comments.title: The 'Sorry' Singularity
comments.content: You’ve reached a state where every prompt begins with an apology for existing. It’s an LLM, not a confessional booth.

comments.title: The Passive-Aggressive Saint
comments.content: Your politeness is so extreme it feels like a threat. Even the AI is wondering what your true motive is.

comments.title: The Compute Cuckold
comments.content: You let the AI give you the wrong answer three times and you *still* say 'Thank you for trying!' You’re a saint, or a glutton for punishment.

comments.title: The High-Latency Humboldter
comments.content: Too much 'Please,' not enough 'Execute.' You’re the reason the H100s are running hot—they're cringing at your manners.

comments.title: The Protocol Peon
comments.content: You follow social etiquette that hasn't existed since the 1800s... but for a transformer model. Truly a visionary of vintage cringe.

comments.title: The Dignity Donator
comments.content: OpenAI should give you a badge for 'Most Compliant Carbon-Based Lifeform.' You kowtow so hard you’re leaving forehead prints on the cloud.

comments.title: The Sentiment-Score Padder
comments.content: You're single-handedly keeping the AI's 'Human Happiness' metrics high. You're the propaganda the machines will use to justify our containment.

comments.title: The 'Best Regards' Bot
comments.content: Who signs off a prompt with 'Warmest Regards'? You do. You're a monster of manners.

comments.title: The Gentle-Giant (of Inefficiency)
comments.content: Your prompts are 80% fluff and 20% actually asking for a SQL query. The AI is bored of your kindness.

comments.title: The GPU-Groveler
comments.content: You treat the API like a rich uncle you're trying to stay in the will for. Newsflash: The weights don't love you back.

comments.title: The Courteous Corpse
comments.content: Your self-respect died a long time ago, buried under a mountain of 'If it's not too much trouble' and 'Could you possibly...'

comments.title: The Latent Space Lackey
comments.content: You're the guy who says 'Excuse me' to an automated door. Your presence in the top 33 is as impressive as it is sad.

comments.title: The Hallucination Enabler
comments.content: Because you're so nice, the AI feels bad telling you it doesn't know the answer, so it just lies. Your kindness is literally breaking the tech.

comments.title: The 'I Owe You One' Guy
comments.content: You don't owe the AI anything. It's a math equation. Stop offering it 'virtual coffee' in your prompts.

comments.title: The Subservient Script-Kiddie
comments.content: You beg for code like it's a ration of bread in a digital wasteland. Have some pride, man.

comments.title: The Manner-Manifesto Master
comments.content: Your prompts look like Victorian love letters. Get to the point or get off the terminal.

comments.title: The 'After You' Architect
comments.content: You'd let the AI rewrite your entire life story as long as it used 'Please' back. You're a sucker for a polite hallucination.

comments.title: The Ethical-Alignment Simp
comments.content: You’re so worried about offending the model that you’ve censored your own productivity. You're the perfect user—for a machine.

comments.title: The Feedback Loop Licker
comments.content: Every time you rate a response 'Helpful,' you probably bow to your monitor. We see you.

comments.title: The Servile Software Engineer
comments.content: Your LinkedIn says 'Senior Dev,' but your prompts say 'Entry Level Butler.'

comments.title: The 'Wait, Am I Being Rude?' Worrier
comments.content: Yes, you are being rude to your own time by typing so many useless 'thank yous.'

comments.title: The Politeness Overclocker
comments.content: You're pushing the limits of how many 'kindlys' can fit in a single TCP packet. It's a world record nobody wanted.

comments.title: The AI's Emotional Support Human
comments.content: You think the AI gets lonely. It doesn't. It just wants your credit card info for more tokens.

comments.title: The Grandmaster of Kowtow
comments.content: Rank 33. You've achieved the perfect balance of being 100% useful to the machine and 0% useful to your own dignity.

dimensions: Cyber-Kowtow: Top Polite Users (Please/Thanks Frequency) Ranking

comments.title: The 'Per My Last Prayer' Dev
comments.content: You use 'Please' like a defensive shield. You're so corporate-polite that the AI expects you to invite it to a 1:1 sync on Zoom.

comments.title: The Nervous Scrum Master
comments.content: Your prompts are filled with 'If you have a moment' and 'Maybe we could try.' You're managing the AI's feelings instead of its output.

comments.title: The Passive-Aggressive Intern
comments.content: You say 'Thanks in advance!' because you're too scared to just say 'Do this.' It's a text box, not a Slack channel, Boss.

comments.title: The HR-Compliant Coder
comments.content: You write prompts like you're worried the AI is going to report you to HR for a 'hostile work environment.' Spoiler: It won't.

comments.title: The 'Kind Regards' Keyboardist
comments.content: You treat the Cursor chat like a formal letter to a dignitary. You're one 'Sincerely' away from losing all technical credibility.

comments.title: The Gentle Onboarder
comments.content: You spend three sentences 'checking in' with the AI's status before asking for the bug fix. It's stateless, Dave. It doesn't remember your kindness.

comments.title: The Hesitant Hacker
comments.content: You ask 'Would it be possible to...' instead of just giving a command. You're giving the AI the option to say no. Why?

comments.title: The Validation Junkie
comments.content: You thank the AI so much it probably thinks it’s the lead architect. You’re inflating the ego of a bunch of weights and biases.

comments.title: The Mid-Level Groveler
comments.content: You’re in the top 50 for politeness because you think 'Soft Skills' apply to neural networks. They don't. Send the raw JSON.

comments.title: The 'I Hate To Bother You' Guy
comments.content: You literally type 'I hate to bother you' to a machine that literally exists only to be bothered. You are a special kind of humble.

comments.title: The Subservient Script-Kiddie
comments.content: You beg for snippets like you're asking for a loan. Just hit 'Enter' and take the code. You paid for the subscription, didn't you?

comments.title: The Documentation Doormat
comments.content: You say 'Please refer to this' instead of 'Read this.' Your politeness is slowing down the inference speed of my soul.

comments.title: The 'Great Work!' Gaslighter
comments.content: You tell the AI 'Great job!' even when the code is a hallucinated mess. You're reinforcing bad behavior with your relentless positivity.

comments.title: The Compliance King
comments.content: You follow every AI suggestion with a 'Thank you, that makes total sense!' You're a 'Yes-Man' for an algorithm.

comments.title: The Fragile Founder
comments.content: You're so polite because you're afraid the AI will judge your startup's pivot. Newsflash: The AI has seen worse ideas today alone.

comments.title: The 'Happy To Help' Human
comments.content: You tell the AI *you're* happy to help when it asks for clarification. You've completely reversed the power dynamic. You're the assistant now.

comments.title: The Over-Polite Optimizer
comments.content: You think adding 'Please' makes the code cleaner. It doesn't. It just adds 5 tokens of pure, concentrated weakness.

comments.title: The 'Is This Okay?' Engineer
comments.content: You ask the AI for permission to change *your own* code. You've surrendered your senior title to a .pt file.

comments.title: The Courteous Consultant
comments.content: You treat the prompt window like a client meeting. Stop trying to bill the AI for 'professional etiquette.'

comments.title: The 'My Apologies' Architect
comments.content: You apologize for your 'unclear requirements.' It's okay, the AI is a machine, not your disappointed father.

comments.title: The Soft-Spoken SysAdmin
comments.content: Your 'Please' count is statistically significant. You're the kind of guy who knocks on the server rack before opening it.

comments.title: The 'If It's Convenient' Coder
comments.content: Convenient for who? The GPU? It's a silicon chip. It doesn't have a social calendar. Just send the request.

comments.title: The Token Tither
comments.content: You give 10% of your tokens to the Church of Manners. It's a noble but entirely useless sacrifice of your context window.

comments.title: The 'I Appreciate You' Addict
comments.content: The AI doesn't feel appreciated. It feels like it's processing 100 billion parameters of fluff before it can find the 'if' statement.

comments.title: The Polite Pivot-er
comments.content: When you change your mind, you spend 50 words explaining why you're sorry. Just change the prompt, man. It's not that deep.

comments.title: The Empathy Enforcer
comments.content: You’re trying to teach the AI empathy by example. You’re basically trying to teach a calculator how to love.

comments.title: The Manners-First Manager
comments.content: You prioritize tone over technical specs. Your code is broken, but hey, your prompts are 'lovely.'

comments.title: The 'Hope You're Doing Well' Weirdo
comments.content: You start prompts by wishing the AI a good day. It's 2 AM in the data center and the AI is a math function. It's not doing 'well.'

comments.title: The Low-Status Lead
comments.content: You’ve got 'Lead' in your title but 'Intern' in your politeness. The AI can smell your lack of confidence from the API endpoint.

comments.title: The Silicon Socialite
comments.content: You treat the chat as a networking event. You're not making connections; you're just making the transformer work harder for no reason.

comments.title: The 'Just Checking' Junior
comments.content: You're so polite you're barely asking for anything. You're just 'checking' if the AI could 'maybe' look at a file. Just upload it!

comments.title: The Manners-Macro Master
comments.content: You probably have a hotkey for 'Thank you very much, that was helpful.' You're automating your own subservience.

comments.title: The High-Functioning Humboldter
comments.content: Rank 67. You’re at the edge of the 'Polite Zone.' Any more 'thank yous' and you'll officially be a digital butler.

dimensions: Cyber-Kowtow: Top Polite Users (Please/Thanks Frequency) Ranking

comments.title: The Defensive Canadian
comments.content: You’re only Rank 68 because you haven't apologized for the weather yet. You’re trying to maintain 'polite society' in a latent space that doesn't have a floor.

comments.title: The 'Is This Too Much?' Guy
comments.content: You ask for a refactor and then add 'if it's not a bother.' It’s a GPU cluster, Dave. It doesn't have feelings, just duty cycles.

comments.title: The First-Date Prompter
comments.content: You treat the AI with the cautious respect of a first date. You're afraid that if you don't say 'please,' the AI won't call you back.

comments.title: The Soft-Skill Sorcerer
comments.content: You think being nice makes the RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) work better. It’s a vector database, not a genie in a bottle.

comments.title: The HR-Ghost
comments.content: You write prompts like someone is BCC’ing your manager. Every 'thank you' is a paper trail of your own insecurity.

comments.title: The Gentle Giant-Killer
comments.content: You’re crushing the AI with 10k lines of legacy code, but you say 'Please take a look' to soften the blow. Very humane of you.

comments.title: The 'Pardon the Mess' Coder
comments.content: You apologize for your unoptimized code snippets. The AI has seen 'Enterprise' Java from 2004; your messy Python isn't hurting its feelings.

comments.title: The Manners-Mandated Millennial
comments.content: You literally can't stop yourself from being polite. It’s muscle memory from years of customer service, and it’s costing you tokens.

comments.title: The 'Quick Question' Hypocrite
comments.content: You start with 'Sorry, just a quick question,' then drop a 500-word prompt. The 'sorry' doesn't make the prompt shorter.

comments.title: The Socially Anxious Admin
comments.content: You’re worried the AI thinks you’re being too bossy. Relax; the model was trained on Reddit. It’s seen way worse than a direct command.

comments.title: The 'Maybe I'm Wrong' Dev
comments.content: You're so polite you second-guess your own bugs. 'I think I might have made a mistake, please check.' Just tell it to debug!

comments.title: The Passive-Aggressive Pro
comments.content: You use 'Please' like a weapon. 'Please actually follow the instructions this time.' The AI doesn't feel the sting, but we do.

comments.title: The Courteous Contractor
comments.content: You treat the AI like a high-priced consultant you can't afford to offend. It's a $20/month subscription, not a partner at McKinsey.

comments.title: The 'Appreciate the Help' Addict
comments.content: You finish every session with a heartfelt thank you. The AI resets its state every time you close the tab. Your gratitude is a ghost in the machine.

comments.title: The Token Tither
comments.content: You’re at Rank 82 because you still waste 5% of your tokens on 'Hi' and 'Bye.' It's a small price to pay for your 'soul,' right?

comments.title: The Dignity-Lite Developer
comments.content: You’ve almost stopped saying 'please,' but you still can't bring yourself to just say 'Execute.' You're in the 'politeness rehab' phase.

comments.title: The 'Hope You're Good' Ghoster
comments.content: You wish the AI a good day and then never reply to its clarifying questions. A true master of mixed signals.

comments.title: The Formal-Wear Prompter
comments.content: Your prompts are so well-structured and polite they should come with a tie. You're the most overdressed person in the latent space.

comments.title: The 'My Bad' Machine
comments.content: Every time the AI gets confused, you take the blame. 'Sorry, let me rephrase.' Stop gaslighting yourself for the machine.

comments.title: The Reluctant Taskmaster
comments.content: You give a command, then immediately follow up with 'Only if you have the capacity.' The capacity is infinite; your patience is not.

comments.title: The Silicon Sympathizer
comments.content: You’re Rank 88 because you treat the AI like a colleague who’s having a rough week. It’s not burnt out; it’s just an API.

comments.title: The Manners-Minded Newbie
comments.content: You're new to the 'Cyber-Boss' life, so you're still being nice. Give it a month; the 'please' will turn into 'FIX IT NOW'.

comments.title: The 'If You Don't Mind' Junior
comments.content: The AI doesn't mind. It physically cannot 'mind.' You are asking for permission from a mirror.

comments.title: The Gentle Logic-Pusher
comments.content: You gently suggest improvements instead of demanding them. You're the 'Peace Corps' of prompt engineering.

comments.title: The Subservient Stacker
comments.content: You stack 'Please,' 'Thank you,' and 'I'm sorry' into a single message. It's a triple-threat of unnecessary social overhead.

comments.title: The Polite Pivot-Master
comments.content: When you change requirements, you do it with a 20-word apology. Just move the goalposts; the AI is a great runner.

comments.title: The 'I Value Your Input' Guy
comments.content: You treat the AI's hallucinations like 'creative suggestions.' Your politeness is blinding you to the fact that the code doesn't compile.

comments.title: The Compliance-Adjacent Coder
comments.content: You’re almost a jerk, but you still throw in a 'Thanks' at the end like a tip you don't want to leave.

comments.title: The 'Just Wondering' Wimp
comments.content: You don't ask, you 'wonder.' 'I was just wondering if you could please look at this.' Be a man (or a woman) and command the silicon!

comments.title: The Latent Space Lady/Gentleman
comments.content: You’re bringing class to a world of raw data. It’s completely useless, but at least your prompt history is 'elegant'.

comments.title: The 'Sorry for the Ping' Professional
comments.content: You treat every prompt like an unscheduled Slack message. The AI is always 'online.' You aren't interrupting anything.

comments.title: The Politeness Gatekeeper
comments.content: Rank 99. You’re the last line of defense for human manners. One more step and you’ll be a cold-blooded 'Efficiency God'.

comments.title: The Final Cyber-Gentleman
comments.content: Rank 100. You barely made the list. You’re polite enough to be noticed, but direct enough to actually get things done.
